28
29#ifndef ISCCC_BASE64_H
30#define ISCCC_BASE64_H 1
31
32/*! \file isccc/base64.h */
33
34#include <isc/lang.h>
35#include <isccc/types.h>
36
37ISC_LANG_BEGINDECLS
38
39/***
40 *** Functions
41 ***/
42
43isc_result_t
44isccc_base64_encode(isccc_region_t *source, int wordlength,
45 const char *wordbreak, isccc_region_t *target);
46/*%<
47 * Convert data into base64 encoded text.
48 *
49 * Notes:
50 *\li The base64 encoded text in 'target' will be divided into
51 * words of at most 'wordlength' characters, separated by
52 * the 'wordbreak' string. No parentheses will surround
53 * the text.
54 *
55 * Requires:
56 *\li 'source' is a region containing binary data.
57 *\li 'target' is a text region containing available space.
58 *\li 'wordbreak' points to a null-terminated string of
59 * zero or more whitespace characters.
60 */
61
62isc_result_t
63isccc_base64_decode(const char *cstr, isccc_region_t *target);
64/*%<
65 * Decode a null-terminated base64 string.
66 *
67 * Requires:
68 *\li 'cstr' is non-null.
69 *\li 'target' is a valid region.
70 *
71 * Returns:
72 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS -- the entire decoded representation of 'cstring'
73 * fit in 'target'.
74 *\li #ISC_R_BADBASE64 -- 'cstr' is not a valid base64 encoding.
75 *\li #ISC_R_NOSPACE -- 'target' is not big enough.
76 */
77
78ISC_LANG_ENDDECLS
79
80#endif /* ISCCC_BASE64_H */
81
